page.title: 02GOVERNMENT
page.content: The{H.C.C.}spend Â£666,000,000 a year. They employ 38,000 people.Nearly 1000 people work in The Castle.H.C.C. cover the whole of Hampshire. It also pays for education, housing, employment, social services, transport, public protection, countryside and health.The education department employs the most people. The county surveyors buy and sell land.The busy{Chief Executive}has about 15 meetings a week. Particularly in Southampton and Portsmouth he would like unemployment to decline.He has two secretaries one being a personal assistant.The{County Education Officer spends Â£343,000,000 in controlling 677 schools. There are 12,000 teachers and 225,000 children. He would like more money to make smaller classes, provide more equipment and to brighten up schools.He helps choose headteachers but the heads choose other teachers.
